> Ascheritte defeated Crawler. [[ Party: Nel, Tatsumaki, Aelriss, Donnel ]]

"Solid." Nel maneuvers to your side as you pull your weapon out of the bloody crawler husk. The five of you are lurking in the corner of a cave about halfway between Averron City and the lower branches; Aelriss and Donnel joined your party not too long ago, replacing Ayla, who went to join the Alliance leaders, and Vision, who since logged out. Allegedly, the Nameless have been incited into a riot which is currently underway in Averron City; you and your party, along with the remaining members of Aelriss and Donnel's party, were forced to fight off about a dozen Nameless immediately outside the ruins, and are now in search of something else to do.

The cave you've settled in is a little out of the way, though occasionally crawlers pop up from the ground nearby. The five of you have established a system of exterminating them; they seem easier to kill now that you've leveled up and loosened up.

The two of you return to the campfire where Tatsumaki, Aelriss, and Donnel are waiting. Sitting down on a flat-topped stalagmite, you extend your hands, bathing them in the warmth of the flames before you. They feel no less real than before. How long until this stops impressing you, you wonder? Have you yet felt every sensation this world has to offer? Perhaps, if you could acquire more Celestial Gems, then...

> [[ Continued ]]

38003702.name: BSO
38003702.comment:
>>38003684

"Ascheritte, are you alright?" Aelriss asks, waving a hand in front of your face.

"Hm? Oh, yeah." You shake your head. "I was just thinking."

"Right." Donnel chimes in. "Well, good fighting nonetheless, you two. Aelriss was just telling us what she's figured out about the elements. Apparently, there's three whole tiers, with..."

"Hey, I know this." Nel folds his arms. "Fire, water, earth, and wind are Tier 3. Ice, lightning, dark, and light are T-2, and T-1 was... uhm."

"Gravity," Aelriss begins. "Nature, time, and life."

"There could be plenty more, knowing this game." Nel responds. "Anyway, what are we thinking of doing?"

"I'm not sure." Donnel says. "Peace in Averron City seems tenuous, but we're going to have to go back eventually, and I'd really like an opportunity to visit the market and vendors."

"Mhm." Tatsumaki nods.

"What if that's not an option?" Nel asks, standing and circling around the fire to face the entire party.

"Not sure." Aelriss says. The conversation stalls. "But, we can't just sit here forever. Who's got some ideas?"

> "Let's try to get back to Averron. The guilds could use our help."
> "Let's investigate another branch of the ruins. It won't be that dangerous."
> "Aelriss, how do you get elemental equipment?"
> Other

38004862.name: BSO
38004862.comment:
>>38003702

"I think we should head back to the city." You say. "I have a feeling the guilds could use our help."

"Gross," Nel sighs. "You already want to duke it out with more Nameless?"

"I'm behind it." Donnel says. "The more we kill, the better. Tell me I'm wrong."

"They aren't all bad, Donnel. There are probably people in the city being killed unfairly--"Aelriss begins, but Donnel interrupts.

"You saw what happened when we trusted the last one! I gave you the benefit of the doubt, and we almost got killed for that." He says, rising from his seat on a stone outcropping. "No more of this nonsense. From here on out, we're playing this game the way it was meant to be played."

"How do you know what that is?" Aelriss folds her arms, rising from her own seat, with Tatsumaki caught between her and Donnel's cold stares. The conversation stalls again. Nel nudges you with an elbow, and the two of you decide to take the lead, heading back up towards Averron City. The rest of the party falls in line behind the two of you after another second or two of silence.

You remember the road back up well, Nel carefully inspecting a map on his Unique Identifier as the five of you cross a bridge over the familiar white abyss below. You've seen a branch of the ruins now, which leaves you wondering where that leads, and how much space there really is down there. You feel like this walk is a little shorter than it should be, but you aren't complaining; walking is just tiring enough to feel real.

> [[ Continued ]]

38004879.name: BSO
38004879.comment:
>>38004862

"Aelriss, how do you get elemental equipment?" You ask over your shoulder, trying to make conversation.

"Artificers can put elemental focuses into your items, is the gist of it." Nel says.

"Foci." Aelriss corrects him. "Sources of elemental power can be harvested naturally or dropped from monsters, depending on your discipline and your particular preference. The best ones come from bosses, but I'm told you have to work for them, completing particular rituals or cutting off wings and tails by dealing direct damage to those particular locations."

"Ah," You recall. "I played a game like that, once."

"But the power and specific workings of particular foci can vary wildly depending on what they're from and what types of equipment you fuse them with." She continues.

"Some artificers apparently found a Dark focus in a branch of the ruins, but apparently you can't even work with upper-tier elements without something called an 'aetheric resonator'." Nel says.

"Ah!" Aelriss's eyes light up. "Did they say where to get one?"

"Nope." He responds, deadpan. "Sounds expensive, though. Or rare."

"Damnit..." Aelriss frowns, looking disappointed.

"You're sure this is the right way, Nel?" You ask, glancing over another bridge.

"Taking a shortcut." He responds. "Should be right through here..."

38004915.name: BSO
38004915.comment:
>>38004879

You emerge from the mouth of one of the upper caves, and the warehouse district gate comes into view. There's what looks like a skirmish underway up ahead, with the ranks of the Averron Guard broken by a group of Nameless. Three guardsmen stand a ways apart from one another, looking for an approach angle on the group of four Nameless they're surrounding.

The Nameless, though, are set on other targets. They're engaged in combat with an absolutely massive, greataxe-wielding man--you think he maxed his avatar's dimensions--wearing red-trimmed armor, marked with a familiar logo. Crimson Guard. They're lashing in and out like the sisters with chromatic hair you fought earlier, taking turns to keep the adjacent guardsmen at bay.

They're chipping away at the Crimson's armor. It seems like they're too fast for him; then, he twirls his axe overhead and levels it in a wide, barreling maneuver that cleaves through a member of the Nameless group, shoulder to waist. He spins, spiked shield ready, and takes a hit to the back that doesn't seem to bother him. Rather than block the next attack, he bashes the next Nameless with his shield, immobilizing him for long enough for the Crimson to essentially fall on him, shield forward, planting the spike through his chest.

He rolls aside to dodge a blow from behind, and the members of the Guard move in to finish off the third kill before helping the Crimson to his feet. The four of them begin to make their way into the city, with you following cautiously a ways behind them. You hear yelling, and think you can see smoke rising from over the city wall. 

[[ 1 ]]
> Get in contact with Ayla.
> Get in contact with Smith.
> Head in to help secure the city center.
> Search for suspicious activity in the warehouse district.
> Other.

[[ 2 ]]
Spend a point on Weapon Mastery?

Three guardsmen stand a ways apart from one another, looking for an approach angle on the group of four Nameless they're surrounding.

The Nameless, though, are set on other targets. They're engaged in combat with an absolutely massive, greataxe-wielding man--you think he maxed his avatar's dimensions--wearing red-trimmed armor, marked with a familiar logo. Crimson Guard. They're lashing in and out like the sisters with chromatic hair you fought earlier, taking turns to keep the adjacent guardsmen at bay.

They're chipping away at the Crimson's armor. It seems like they're too fast for him; then, he twirls his axe overhead and levels it in a wide, barreling maneuver that cleaves through a member of the Nameless group, shoulder to waist. He spins, spiked shield ready, and takes a hit to the back that doesn't seem to bother him. Rather than block the next attack, he bashes the next Nameless with his shield, immobilizing him for long enough for the Crimson to essentially fall on him, shield forward, planting the spike through his chest.

He rolls aside to dodge a blow from behind, and the members of the Guard move in to finish off the third kill before helping the Crimson to his feet. The four of them begin to make their way into the city, with you following cautiously a ways behind them. You hear yelling, and think you can see smoke rising from over the city wall.

38005486.name: Anonymous
38005486.comment:
>>38004915

You give Ayla a call. It's a moment before she answers; the hologram screen is a shot of her with a bruised face and her back pressed to a wall. There's flashes of caster fire and faint explosions that are just a little bit out of phase with the distant explosions you catch from over the city walls.

"Ascheritte?" She asks. "What's going on? I'm a little busy."

"I actually wanted to ask you what was going on." You respond. "We just got back to Averron. Is something wrong?"

"They've got groups camping outside the guild halls. We're trying to do something about it, but Liza's spread her guild too thin." Ayla grits her teeth. "She stormed off towards the warehouse district and I haven't been able to get in contact with her since, which doesn't bode well, considering that's where Freakshow has been the most active recently."

"Do you need anything?" You ask.

"I'd like it if you could be careful. This whole thing got a lot worse than we anticipated. It's bigger than just Freakshow and some Nameless." She responds. "Random people from off the street have gotten killed or pulled into the fighting. People who don't have anything to do with it are just looting everyone and taking swings for the hell of it. Most of 'em don't even know why they're fighting anymore."

There's another explosion, and her eyes widen. She shouts, sprinting out of view before the call ends. You try to call Smith, but he doesn't respond. His workshop is in this district, though; perhaps you could go check?

You glance upward, catching a player and a pair of Nameless moving across external scaffolding on a tall, blocky warehouse building. The three of them carefully open a wooden door and shuffle inside; you think you catch a glimpse of Freakshow bandanas on their upper arms.

> Head for Smith's workshop.
> Search for a ground entrance to that warehouse.
> Climb up to the warehouse scaffolding.
> Head for the guild halls.
> Other.

38006129.name: Anonymous
38006129.comment:
>>38005486

"This way. We'll see if my friend is here." With Nel and the others watching your corners, you lead the party through the narrow district corridors toward where Smith indicated his workshop was. The building's aren't that tall; the architecture is blocky and a bit rusty. Dirty-looking alleyways connect city block to city block, and every other building seems to have a fire escape or a metal scaffold running its circumference.

You get a feel for the warehouse district pretty quickly, but you understand the warnings. It'd be easy to get lost in a place like this. It's the darkest part of the city, and you feel like you're being watched everywhere you go, though you've got a whole party with you.

"Uhm, Ashe?" Nel asks. "Is this the place?"

You arrive at a building in the approximate area, and recognize the arrangement of exterior windows from your call with Smith. The door is wide open, and there's two dead players curled up outside, bodies cut and burnt. Tatsumaki and Aelriss run forward to investigate, but you recognize them, even from here, as the two people who burst in on Smith during your call earlier.

"They're just Nameless." You say. "They attacked Smith when I was talking to him, before we came up."

"Uhm," Donnel says. "They're wearing Disposable Heroes tabards. Does that guild invite Nameless?"

"I didn't think so." Nel says. "Do they have UIs?"

"They've got nothing." Aelriss says. Tatsumaki makes an 'empty-handed' gesture. You look around. It's dark inside the workshop. Smith is nowhere to be seen, and you still can't shake the feeling someone is watching you.

> Head inside.
> Other.

"Alright, boys." Nel cracks his knuckles. "Time for a good old-fashioned breach-and-clear."

"Sounds tactical." Aelriss says.

"We should probably just open the door." You sigh, pausing to listen to the sound of gunfire and unintelligible shouting reverberating from inside. "Everyone ready?"

You swing the double-doors open. The warehouse floor is littered with the fragments of destroyed wooden crates, metal scraps, and damaged weapons. There's enormous black scorch marks on the ground where explosives were detonated, and running up the walls toward the upper door, which opens onto an inner scaffold that runs the circumference of the building, terminating in a staircase on the left wall.

And the dead Nameless. All three of the original group, the player included, litter the catwalk, riddled with stab wounds. There's six more about the floor of the room, lying amidst the scattered piles of objects.

There's a duel underway in the middle of the room, between a pair of Identified players. A woman, armed with a luminescent spear, and clad from the neck down in masterwork armor of a brilliant red hue. The other, you've seen before, down in the ruins: loose clothing, long hair, and empty eyes, wielding a long, curved sword with a hilt made of a chitinous-looking material.

They're fast, and neither one is conceding an inch. The two of them are weaving abilities into their styles. You see the woman activate Haste, and she's occasionally bearing down on his dodges with an almost imperceptibly fast strike; the other is more fluid in his movements, taking slower and more deliberate sword swings that leave crackling green scars in the air adjacent.

"She's Crimson!" Donnel shouts.

"Mm? ...Reinforcements?" The man somersaults backwards at a moment's notice, disengaging from combat. He holds the Guardian at length with his sword, then begins channeling energy as if he's casting a spell.

"What?" The Guardian looks between your group and him, evidently thrown off. "Who are you?"

She charges, unafraid, moving into range with an upward swing of her spear--that just doesn't seem to connect. Another swing of his sword barely seems to catch her, but sends a wave of crackling energy dancing across her armor, and she stumbles backards, stunned.

What will you do?
> Keep watching.
> Tackle him.
> Try to attack him from length with your sword.
> Other.

38009569.name: BSO
38009569.comment:
>>38008715

"That guy was the one in charge of the Nameless who attacked us!" Donnel says. "What do we do?"

"I'm going." You say.

"What?"

The Guardian is beginning to recover. She grits her teeth and roars, twirling her spear in front of her before launching forward at the swordsman.

A beat, as you dive forward, away from your party, and slam your sword into the ground in front of them hard enough to break through the warehouse floor, sending chips of stone and bits of broken wood scattering and bouncing in all directions. The swordsman smiles, and--still holding his sword--raises his hands skyward, in a gesture of surrender.

"Please." He says, calmly. "Not to say I'm not enjoying myself, but let's not get carried away."

"I'm not through with you." She points her spear at him before lowering it to her side and looking at you, turning a bit to keep her weapon between her and the swordsman. "You lot! What is the meaning of this? What are you doing?" 

"Protecting you!"

"You're both players, aren't you?" Aelriss steps forward. "Why are you fighting?"

"Ael, please, she literally just killed nine dudes." Nel whispers hoarsely, eyes wide.

"I agree with that girl." The swordsman chuckles, sticking a thumb at Aelriss. "Why are we fighting, Liza? I've watched you cut down so many members of my guild. I see no reason for you to make an attempt on my pride."

"Anaximander, you honorless bastard." Liza hisses. "Your actions are responsible for the deaths of countless players. You've orchestrated kill teams at player spawn locations! You've caused a riot that's destroying Averron as we speak!"

"Liza, you're acting like a child. I have eyes everywhere. I've seen what you've done. You've sent the members of your guild to defend the most remote locations in the city, so that you could come hunt me undeterred." Anaximander laughs, and you recall Ayla's words--about Liza's spreading the Guardians too thin.

38009589.name: BSO
38009589.comment:
>>38009569

"Undetected, not undeterred." Liza says, hefting her spear again and assuming a fighting stance. "It'd have worked, too, were it not for this group's timely intervention."

"Liza." You say. "Why fight him alone?"

"Because!" Anaximander laughs, stretching his back and placing his sword like a yoke over his shoulders. "The Alliance has no way to implicate me or my guilds in any of these events! Even with eye-witnesses, it still falls upon the word-of-mouth of untrustworthy folk. The Alliance were sworn not to act in this matter, instead choosing to maintain peace, a peace which Liza herself has broken!"

Liza's grip on her weapon tightens. She doesn't respond, and Anaximander continues.

"I'm ashamed, Liza. As an Alliance leader, you should set an example for others. Instead, you've chosen to overstep your boundaries. You've defied the principles you've forced the players in this city to obey! You've broken the peace you've established!" He shouts. "And, you've chosen to act as a free agent! A coward! You are no Guardian!"

Welp, that did it; you see her eyebrow twitch, and her spear flares. She settles on her back leg. Looks like she's about to jump for it.

Tatsumaki's up next, and you go in at her side. There's no way you'll be able to land a hit on this guy alone, not wielding this sword the way you are. You mull over tactics for a split-second. > [[ 3 ]]

You push your sword down further, and there's a sudden turbulence. Is this a Celestial Artifact? "Wait, what are you doing? Get away from me! I can't--"

The two of you manifest in the air, closer to the cave ceiling than to Averron City. You can see the warehouse district far below. You're falling.

"Ngh!" He plants his free hand on his face, drifting away from you as you fall. Then, his body is cloaked in red, and leaves scarlet afterimages as he closes the distance at high speed, dragging his sword across your chest as he passes by. There's more blood than you're used to, and another stunning shock. "I hope you're happy!"

You're falling, upside down, and you can't move. Red lines are creeping in from the corners of your vision. Averron City is getting larger beneath you. You're about to hit the ground, or the warehouse roof.

38011163.name: BSO
38011163.comment:
>>38010702

You manage to navigate to your UI menu, and spend your lingering experience point on HP. Your maximum health increases, and you feel a measure of vitality returning to your body as your current health scales up in line with your new maximum. You don't know if it'll be enough to survive the hit.

You start yelling, hoping someone will hear you.

> [[ Contact Request: Crimson Guardian Liza ]]

There's a ping, before you close your UI.

> [[ UI Messenger - Crimson Guardian Liza ]]
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Your friends are telling me it's you I'm looking at through the skylight.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: If you're conscious, I'm going to need you to relax. 
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Even if I catch you, you might still die if your health is too low.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: H;ELp
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Stop yelling.

"Celestial Artifact." An echoic call from below you, closer than you imagined. Her voice is resolute, and carries far; you turn, to see a bloom of red light evolving from the warehouse roof. The sound from below you--it's vaguely reminiscent of a jet engine warming up. "Crimson Wings."

Liza ascends, rushing upward to meet you, aided by the metallic scarlet wings unfolding from her armor just below her shoulders. Each one sits atop a blade of raw, silver light, that gives off visible, withering heat, and leaves an iridescent contrail.
Fuck everything, you are totally getting some of those.

She maneuvers toward you, but you seize, as another shock courses through your body. A residual effect? You tumble, falling past her, and hear a sickening crack as she's forced to grab your ankle. Your vision is caked completely in red.

The game sound grows a little dull. You think you're dead.

A brief pause.

"I've got you."

38011195.name: BSO
38011195.comment:
>>38011163

Liza hefts your broken body into her arms as the two of you descend through the destroyed warehouse skylight. "Good work."

She sets you down in the middle of the warehouse floor, amidst broken boxes, scrap parts, and Nameless kills. It's good to be back on the ground. The rest of the party rushes over to meet you, and you feel Eunoia touch down gently on your forehead.

> [[ Ascheritte: 2 / 35 HP ]]

"Ashe! You made it!" Nel shouts, muffling the rest of his speech by falling face-first into your chest. "I knew you'd make it!"

"I'm surprised." Aelriss smiles, leaning on her staff. "That went better than expected."

"Alright, am I the only one who's lost?" Donnel asks. He and Tatsumaki look utterly confused.

"I think Anaximander's escaped." Liza grits her teeth, the Crimson Wings giving off a series of mechanical noises as they fold back beneath her armor. "I suppose I misplayed. I was... not aware he had that ability. That Celestial Artifact is unaccounted for, and with more and more people exploring the Averron ruins, it would be impossible for him to even get enough Gems to make something like it. He'd have to have access to an entire town's worth..."

"You don't think?" Nel turns toward her, cocking an eyebrow.

She pauses, and her eyes widen. "Oh, fuck's sake, there's absolutely no way."

What will you do?
> Write-in
